issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Modify tests that initialize MiniDFSNNTopology with hard-coded ports to use ServerSocketUtil#getPorts

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Unit tests using MiniDFSCluster with namanode-ha enabled need set of port numbers in advance. Because namenodes talk to each other, we can not set ipc port to 0 in configuration to make namenodes decide port number on its own. ServerSocketUtil should provide utility to find set of available ephemeral port numbers for this.

For example, TestEditLogTailer could fail due to {{java.net.BindException: Address already in use}}.

https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk/2556/testReport/
{noformat}

{noformat}
fields.summary: Add utility to find set of available ephemeral ports to ServerSocketUtil

comments.body: There is no way to prevent other processes from using the port given by {{ServerSocketUtil#getPort}} before binding it. Because each namenodes must know addresses of other namenodes on startup, making namenodes decide ipc port on its own (by setting port to 0 in conf) does not work here.  Making NameNode reconfigurable just for unit test is overkill. I think adding retries on starting up mini cluster is reasonable solution here, if this is not so rare situation.

FWIW, the technique I use for finding > 1 free port is to allocate all the server sockets before releasing any of them, in the scala code [FreePortFinder|https://github.com/steveloughran/spark/blob/stevel/feature/SPARK-1537-ATS/yarn/src/history/test/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/history/yarn/testtools/FreePortFinder.scala]. A version in Hadoop would address this problem

Thanks for the input, [~stevel@apache.org]. I think the ports given by the {{findUniquePorts}} is still possible to be used other process in parallel testing environment but it improve the situation. I'm attaching 002 which adds Java equivalent.

Thanks [~iwasakims] for working on this. I agree with you that it's still possible for the ports to conflict but improves this test. 2 minor comments:
- Could you add more details to the javadoc of {{ServerSocketUtil#getPorts}}? Something similar to the [scala comments|https://github.com/steveloughran/spark/blob/stevel/feature/SPARK-1537-ATS/yarn/src/history/test/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/history/yarn/testtools/FreePortFinder.scala#L79] would do.
- Also, shall we mark {{ServerSocketUtil#getPorts}} as {{@VisibleForTesting}}? Not sure if you plan to address similar issues in other places.

Thanks for the comments, [~xiaochen].

bq. Could you add more details to the javadoc of ServerSocketUtil#getPorts? Something similar to the scala comments would do.

Sure. I added comments.

bq. shall we mark ServerSocketUtil#getPorts as @VisibleForTesting? Not sure if you plan to address similar issues in other places.

I think we don't need {{@VisibleForTesting}} here because the ServerSocketUtil.java is under {{src/test}} and {{getPorts}} is intended to be used by other tests.

I added fix to TestNameNodeMXBean and updated summary. Thanks for the suggestion, [~xiaochen].

This message was automatically generated.

thanks [~iwasakims] and [~xiaochen] for great work here..Overall patch looks good to me.. 

one minor nit :

can we change methode name like getFreePorts..? what do you think..?

Thanks for the update, [~xiaochen]. The 006 looks good to me.

bq. can we change methode name like getFreePorts..? what do you think..?

Both {{getPorts}} and {{getFreePorts}} is fine to me. Ideally {{ServerSocketUtils#getPort}} should have consistent naming but it is already used in many tests. I don't think it's worth to deprecate it.

Thanks for the reviews [~iwasakims] and [~brahmareddy].

I also feel naming consistency with {{getPort}} is more important, to indicate this new method is the same intention but returns multiple ports.
Ok.. will commit..
Committed to trunk...[~iwasakims] patch will not directly apply branch-2, there is a conflict in {{TestEditLogTailer}} . can you upload branch-2 patch..

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10492 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10492/])
HDFS-9444. Add utility to find set of available ephemeral ports to (brahma: rev edf0d0f8b2115d4edb5d4932b5ecb15430d94c40)
